definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: I. [[רחם]] (√ of foll.; orig. meaning dub.; Thes be soft, so Gerber:126, cp. Ar. raxuma be soft, gentle (but x orig. cons.?); Dl:HWB 604 b be wide; cf. As. rîmu, rêmu, Ar. rah.ima, NH [[רֶחֶם]], Aram. [[רַחֲמָא]], rah.mo0, all womb; MI:17 [[רחמת]] female captives; vbs. (connexion with [[רֶחֶם]] not wholly clear, cf. Nö:ZMG xi (1886), 151 f., v. [[רַחֲמִים]]): As. râmu, love, compassionate, Ar. rah.ima have compassion, also raxima be inclined toward, affectionate to ( = rh.m acc. to Ar. authorities, v. Lane); Sab. epith. dei [[רחמנן]] Compassionate ( = Ar. 0alorah.ma0nu), CIS:iv. no. 6. 3 Fell:ZMG liv (1900), 252 who cp. epith. [[רחַם]] id.; cf. NH [[רָחַם]] Pi.; Thes cp. Eth. mah.ra: (transp.) have compassion, but v. Prät:BAS i. 21 and reff.; Aram. [[רְחֵם]], rh.em, Palm. [[רחם]], all love (common); Nab. Palm. [[רחם]] friend).
